page.title: 01The Islands of Loch Lomand
page.content:
This block consists mainly of islands. Here are the details of a few:
INCHMOAN: This island once provided fuel for the village of Luss because of its stock of peat. It also has a sandy beach if you are interested as a tourist.
BUCINCH & CEARDACH: These two islands are owned by the National Trust for Scotland. Ceardach is one of the smallest named islands in Loch Lomand.
INCHTAVANNACH: In the dark ages Celtic missionaries called their congregation by ringing a bell. There was such a bell on the hill of this island and it is for this reason that the hill is called 'Tomnaclang' or hill of the bell.
